thread.title: Chemical weapons inspectors on scene of UK nerve agent attack

title: Chemical weapons inspectors on scene of UK nerve agent attack

organizations.name: organisation for the prohibition of chemical weapons

text: March 21, 2018 / 1:48 PM / Updated 3 minutes ago Chemical weapons inspectors on scene of UK nerve agent attack Reuters Staff 1 Min Read SALISBURY, England (Reuters) - Inspectors from the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) have begun work at the scene of the nerve agent attack on former Russian agent Sergei Skripal in the English city of Salisbury, a Reuters photographer said. Inspectors from the Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) arrive to begin work at the scene of the nerve agent attack on former Russian agent Sergei Skripal, in Salisbury, Britain March 21, 2018. REUTERS/Peter Nicholls Slideshow (2 Images) The inspectors were seen arriving at the Mill pub in Salisbury where Skripal and his daughter Yulia had a drink on March 4. The pair were later found unconscious on a bench outside The Maltings shopping center. They remain critically ill in hospital. Reporting by Peter Nicholls, writing by Guy Faulconbridge, editing by Stephen Addison
